Interface GameMode

All Known Implementing Classes:
NormalMode, ZenMode
public interface GameMode
Defines the contract for different game strategies (modes) within the application.

This interface is the core of the Strategy Design Pattern. By implementing this interface, different classes (e.g., NormalMode, ZenMode) can define their own set of rules for scoring, leveling, and game-over behaviors.

Architectural Benefit: This adheres to the Open/Closed Principle. New game modes (like "Time Attack" or "Hardcore") can be added by creating new implementations of this interface without modifying the existing GameController logic.

Version:
1.0
Author:
[Your Name]

  • Method Details

    • isHighScoreEnabled

      boolean isHighScoreEnabled()
      Determines if the current game session should be recorded in the high score file.
      Returns:
      true if the score should be saved (e.g., Normal Mode); false for practice modes.

    • isLevelingEnabled

      boolean isLevelingEnabled()
      Determines if the game difficulty (speed) should increase as lines are cleared.
      Returns:
      true if leveling is active; false if the speed remains constant (Zen Mode).

    • isDangerAllowed

      boolean isDangerAllowed()
      Determines if "Danger" visual effects (shaking, intense music) should play when the stack reaches the top of the board.
      Returns:
      true to enable danger effects; false to disable them (for a relaxing experience).

    • isLevelLabelVisible

      boolean isLevelLabelVisible()
      Controls the visibility of the Level counter in the UI.
      Returns:
      true to show the label; false to hide it.

    • getUndoLimit

      int getUndoLimit()
      Defines the maximum number of times a player can use the "Undo" feature.
      Returns:
      the number of allowed undos (e.g., 3 for Normal, Integer.MAX_VALUE for Zen).

    • handleGameOver

      void handleGameOver(GameController controller)
      Defines the behavior when a game-over condition (brick overflow) is met.

      Strategies implement this to either show the "Game Over" screen or to automatically restart the game for continuous play.

      Parameters:
      controller - the GameController instance, used to trigger UI changes or board resets.
